content.prompt: The cartoon above from seventeenth-century England is an attempt to ridicule

choices.label: support of William and Mary by the Dutch
fighting between royalist and parliamentary armies during the English Civil War
the movement of Puritans to the New World
the widespread practice of wagering on dog fights
the refusal of Quakers to bear arms and fight

topic.text: 3.2: English Civil War and the Glorious Revolution

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain the point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience of a source.
